titlestmt.titleproper: Hermann Walter Pohlsander collection of German histories 1962-1976
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Hermann Walter Pohlsander collection of German histories
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

scopecontent.p: The collection is comprised of a series of narrative descriptions of land and property in Lower Saxony, Germany. The reports provide information on many different villages and towns and some include photographs or illustrations from printed materials. Information about individuals and families is often included. The collection also contains one folder with photostats and photocopies of German church records. Some reports have microfilm/fiche numbers indicated. This collection may duplicate or be related to material held at the Family History Library of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Family History Library, Church of Jesus Christ of the Latter Day Saints: Hermann Walter Pohlsander Genealogische sammlung von Niedersächsischen familien, 800-1975, and Genealogische sammlung von Niedersächsischen familien, 1600- 1900.
